com.percussion.services.assembly
Interface IPSSlotContentFinder

All Superinterfaces:
IPSExtension
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSBaseSlotContentFinder
public interface IPSSlotContentFinder
extends IPSExtension

Slot finders calculate what items are related to a particular content item. Each slot finder is responsible for filtering the returned list of assembly items for the authtype passed into the find method. Information needed for a particular use of a slot finder is passed to the find(IPSAssemblyItem, IPSTemplateSlot, Map) method

Slot finders are reusable across templates, they are referenced by the slots associated with a template.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

getType

IPSSlotContentFinder.Type getType()
Get the type of the slot content finder. Used in the UI to present appropriate decoration where needed

Returns:
the type of the slot content finder, this value is the ordinal of the enumerated type IPSSlotContentFinder.Type.

find

List<IPSAssemblyItem> find(IPSAssemblyItem sourceItem,
                           IPSTemplateSlot slot,
                           Map<String,Object> parameters)
                           throws RepositoryException,
                                  PSFilterException,
                                  PSAssemblyException
Calculate the related items given the configuration of the slot finder instance. The returned ids are ordered. Important information for the rendering of the returned items will be contained in the variables bound in each item, for example, the url of the item for use in a snippet.

This method looks up the filter specified in the source item in the sys_itemfilter parameter and then calls the "regular" find method.

Parameters:
sourceItem - the source content id, never null and must exist in the repository
slot - the slot that the finder is being invoked for, never null
parameters - a set of zero or more parameters, never null. Standard parameter names are defined as constants on this interface.
Returns:
an array of zero or more ordered related slot items, never null, but may be empty
Throws:
RepositoryException - if the source content id does not exist or there is another error in running the slot content finder
PSFilterException - if the named filter is not found
PSAssemblyException - if a problem occurs with the assembly service
